intro: Lappula redowskii var. marginata, commonly known as the redowskii lappia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopdiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a hairy texture, with the margins often displaying a distinctive reddish or pinkish hue. This variant is native to Central Asia and is often found in dry, sandy or rocky soils. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
